channel.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i46.tinypic.com/23jrhhi.jpg[/img]
Loot exp was born on September this month. Currently been playing now for 3 days, up to now im loving runescape and its latest features.I played back in 2006 awhile back! Joined back this year and it looks fab with great new players each day.
[img]http://i45.tinypic.com/2je2w8.jpg[/img]
At first i've been mainly looting for my money and currently made around 5m now i will train my skills to the max and hardest i can to gain good levels and money without havin to loot all the time.
Well more infomation will be gained shortly but heres for screenies......
[img]http://i49.tinypic.com/dqndxl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i46.tinypic.com/2cdiwqt.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i49.tinypic.com/2prdw5c.jpg[/img]
Latest Update
[img]http://i50.tinypic.com/34xjer6.jpg[/img][/center]

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

A level 72 mage converts bones to bananas to make money. People called her a “noob”, no one knows she was hacked at level 50.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Tell that to the level 3’s with all 99’s except combat skills. People refer to combat because the 99’s are decently fast. There are only 9 skills out of 24 that need combat. But you can also get 99 summoning without fighting anything.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

For some people it is. Some people don’t PK at all.

I’ve been playing the game for over 8 years and have never been interested in PKing. And if you look at new content, hardly any of it is for pking either.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

The was based around pking, always was. As of right now, the reason most of us don’t play anymore is its for gambling/buying skills.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @Decimus Decimus
item.description:
@Decimus wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:462678”]Stores/drops don’t house nearly enough to not count it as skill breaking

Also, I don’t think you guys understand that we’re not saying combat isn’t the most important part of the game, we’re just saying there are plenty of people that completely ignore combat without it having any adverse affect on their other stats, and while still enjoying a very large amount of game content. To put it into context with how the discussion started, it wont change in the EOC.[/quote]
Thank You ^

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I didn’t know you guys would take it so literally.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Stores/drops don’t house nearly enough to not count it as skill breaking

Also, I don’t think you guys understand that we’re not saying combat isn’t the most important part of the game, we’re just saying there are plenty of people that completely ignore combat without it having any adverse affect on their other stats, and while still enjoying a very large amount of game content. To put it into context with how the discussion started, it wont change in the EOC.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You would still get stuff you need from stores and drops. Prayer is a combat skill.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:15, topic:462678”]Jc: Take away combat and you would no longer have a need for anything you make. Quests would no longer have any form of challenges, only skill requirements.

You can take away any single non-combat skill and it would still not be totally game breaking.[/quote]Fletching? Cooking? Runecrafting? Prayer? All of those would ruin parts of combat too. Really, combat isn’t that large a part of the game at all. It’s one of the most important and most fun (for some people), but talking strictly about content, it isn’t that large. The problem is this started with someone saying that the other skills wont be affected, which is true. (Except maybe runecrafting and cooking, not sure how much food people will use in the new system) There’s no point to argue the rest Obviously combat is probably the most important part of the game to 90% of people, but it isn’t the largest content wise (even if everything is linked, those other stats dont count as combat) when compared to all non-combat stats.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Jc: Take away combat and you would no longer have a need for anything you make. Quests would no longer have any form of challenges, only skill requirements.

You can take away any single non-combat skill and it would still not be totally game breaking.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:12, topic:462678”][quote author=mihalich link=topic=565880.msg4118901#msg4118901 date=1349452552]

And EOC is?

It’s an upcoming update that will ruin every kind of pure, and most likely whole RuneScape.

I don’t believe it will ruin RuneScape as a whole. Its just changing combat. All the other skills will still be the same.

Combat is largest part of the game.

Opinionated statement ^

Not really; most of the things you do in the game use combat in some form. I understand that within some of those forms, there might be a trace of non-combat usage, but combat is surely a huge factor in the game itself.

Bias statement.
[/quote]Wrong. Every skill (except Construction AFAIK) link to combat.

Woodcutting - logs for fletching bows/arrows or creating fires to cook food - Cooking food to heal health. Fishing is the same way. You mine to get ores to smelt and make armor/weapons, or get essences used with Rune Crafting to make runes. You craft ranging equipment, you mix potions for combat with Herblore using herbs you got by either thieving or farming. You hunt for gear that can help you in combat, or for items that you can use as weapons. You raise your agility to run away fast, and you slay monsters.[/quote]

Just because everything is linked to combat, it doesn’t necessarily mean combat is the largest part of the game.

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Actually, everything links to money. But yea, everything linking to combat doesn’t make it the largest part of the game anyways

Read full topic

item.title: (The real) Loot exp - Defence pure
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“mihalich, post:11, topic:462678”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=565880.msg4118630#msg4118630 date=1349406462]

And EOC is?

It’s an upcoming update that will ruin every kind of pure, and most likely whole RuneScape.

I don’t believe it will ruin RuneScape as a whole. Its just changing combat. All the other skills will still be the same.

Combat is largest part of the game.

Opinionated statement ^

Not really; most of the things you do in the game use combat in some form. I understand that within some of those forms, there might be a trace of non-combat usage, but combat is surely a huge factor in the game itself.
[/quote]
Bias statement.[/quote]Wrong. Every skill (except Construction AFAIK) link to combat.

Woodcutting - logs for fletching bows/arrows or creating fires to cook food - Cooking food to heal health. Fishing is the same way. You mine to get ores to smelt and make armor/weapons, or get essences used with Rune Crafting to make runes. You craft ranging equipment, you mix potions for combat with Herblore using herbs you got by either thieving or farming. You hunt for gear that can help you in combat, or for items that you can use as weapons. You raise your agility to run away fast, and you slay monsters.

Read full topic
